generalSetting.title: General Setting
generalSetting.desctibe: The amount of time after which a user will be logged.
generalSetting.enableTransactionDeclineConsentDescribe: Enabling this function creates records when consent is not given for a purpose on each Interface, allowing Rate of Consent statistics to be calculated.
generalSetting.enableAcknowledgementEmailDescribe: Allows a user to switch on or off the Consent Acknowledgement Email feature for all Interface.
generalSetting.enableReasonNoteDescribe: When adding, changing or withdrawing consent on behalf of a data subject, turning this toggle on will require users to submit an entry in the Reason field via the application interface, bulk import, or through the public API.
generalSetting.enableReasonTemplateDescribe: Allows you to create and manage a list of pre-defined reasons for the admin console and preference centers. This will replace the default free text field for reason notes.
generalSetting.enableDataSubjectsDeletionDescribe: Enabling this will allow users to permanently delete selected data subject records and all transactions.
generalSetting.enableRequireOrganizationPurposesDescrib: Enable this setting to ensure an Organization value is provided while adding or editing a Purpose. Purposes in Draft without an associated Organization will have the root Organization value added by default and Active Purposes will require a new version.

accessTokenLink.recycleRateMoreThan12: Recycle rate must be equal or less than 12 month
accessTokenLink.recycleRateLessThan1: Recycle rate must be equal more than 1 months
accessTokenLink.confirmDetail: Are you sure you want to save ?
accessTokenLink.confirmSuccess: Your confirmation has been successfully completed.
accessTokenLink.failToSave: Your information has an error. Please check again.
accessTokenLink.title: Direct Accessed Token Link
accessTokenLink.amountOfTime: The amount of time after which a user will be logged.
accessTokenLink.accessToken: Creates an access token per data subject to
accessTokenLink.accessTokenNonExpiring: Set Accessed Token Link as Non-Expiring
accessTokenLink.accessTokenSingleUse: Set Accessed Token Link as Single Use
accessTokenLink.magicLinkExpiration: This setting will expire the magic link after it is accessed by the user.
accessTokenLink.suspendAccess: Temporarily suspend access to Preference Centers via data
accessTokenLink.createNewMagicLinks: Creates new magic links for all data subjects. Use after deleting or when replacing all existing magic links.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.description: The amount of time after which a user will be logged.
dataRetention.dataSubjectDescription: Apply a retention policy by defining data subject deletion rules.
dataRetention.dataReceiptDescription: Apply a retention policy by defining data subject receipt deletion rules.
dataRetention.retentionPeriodDescription: Enter the retention period before the data is permanently deleted.
dataRetention.retainDataBasedOnDescription: Select a date attribute for the retention Period.
dataRetention.purposeStatusDescription: Select the purpose statuses to consider when Deleting data subject records. If no statuses are selected, all will be included.
dataRetention.purposesDescription: Select one or more purposes to target for deleting.
dataRetention.keepReceiptsAndTransactionsDescription: Preserve data subject receipts and transaction records following deleting. Both receipts and transactions will remain accessible in the Receipts Reporting view after deleting.
dataRetention.consentTouchPointsDescription: Limit the removal of those originaling from one or more specified Consent Touch Points.
dataRetention.retainReceiptsBasedOnDescription: Select the consent statuses for which receipts will be retained.
dataRetention.anonymizyRecordsDescription: Redact data elements on receipts and transactions that contain personal data.
dataRetention.confirmRetryDescription: Are you sure you want to retry this retention task ?

dateAndTime.description: The amount of time after which a user will be logged.
dateAndTime.importantDescription: This timezone setting will apply to the entire system, including schedules, timestamps, and notifications. Once set, it cannot be changed, so please double-check your selection before confirming.

emailLanguage.description: Activate additional language options for emails sent from the application.
emailLanguage.languageDescription: Select the preferred language for email notifications.

sessionSetting.description: The amount of time after which a user will be logged out due to inactivity.

sessionTimeout.title: Session Timeout
sessionTimeout.description: The amount of time after which a user will be logged out.
sessionTimeout.error: The duration of user inactivity after which the session will automatically expire. The configurable range is a minimum of 5 minutes and a maximum of 24 hours.

enableSessionProtection.title: Enable Session Protection
enableSessionProtection.description: With this setting enabled, a session cookie is required along with the bearer token.

rememberLastLoggedIn.title: Remember Last Logged in Organization
rememberLastLoggedIn.description: When this setting is enabled, the app will remember the organization a user was in when they logged out. When they log back in, they will automatically return to that organization instead of their default one.

interfaceAndBranding.description: Personalize the branding of the application theme by incorporating your organization's logo and color scheme.
interfaceAndBranding.applicationDescription: Upload your organization's logo to display it on the main and sign-in pages.
interfaceAndBranding.pageTitleDescription: Provide a title to be displayed in the application's header.
interfaceAndBranding.applicationThemeDescription: Choose the application theme that has been configured or personalized to align with the appearance of your application.

preferencePurpose.description: Purpose preferences are more granular preferences that can be related to standard purposes to capture a wider range of data subject preferences.

publishedModal.titledesc: You will not be able to make further changes without creating a new version.

affectedPoints.title: Affected Points :
affectedPoints.line1: These datas (Data Element, Standard Purpose, Preference Purpose) will be freez as the current version.
affectedPoints.line2: If there are any changes to these data elements in the future (new version), the system will not automatically update the current data.

publishedModal.areYouSure: Are you sure you want to publish?

unpublishedModal.title: Confirm Unpublish

unpublishedModal.areYouSure: Are you sure you want to unpublish?

info.title: Information
info.titledesc: Please provide the necessary information for the development of an interface to be used for obtaining data subject consent.
info.allVersions: All previous versions of the interface.

interface.translationdescription: When Consent Interface displayed publicly, Consent Interface will use translations for both the default and additional languages.
interface.addlanguage: Select to add translations for your Consent Interface
interface.translationDescription: When Consent Interface displayed publicly, Consent Interface will use translations for both the default and additional languages.
interface.addLanguage: Select to add translations for your Consent Interface

setting.title: Settings
setting.desc: These settings provide control over various aspects of the application, ensuring a seamless and personalized experience.
setting.consentAcknowledgementEmailDesc: Enable this setting to send an email when consent is given for this Interface.
setting.interfaceEventsDesc: Enable this setting to trigger an event when a consent update occurs via this Interface. Additional configuration steps may be required in the Integrations Module.
setting.singleDataSubjectUpdateEventTypeTitle: Single Data Subject Update Event Type
setting.singleDataSubjectUpdateEventTypeDesc: Enabling this setting reduces calls to external systems for Interface with a large number of Purposes. A single event is created after the data subject has been fully updated, rather than separate events for each Purpose. Changing this setting for existing Collection Points will likely require changes in your integration workflows to take advantage of this.
setting.dataSubjectElementChangesDesc: Enable this feature to send smaller payloads when a data subject element is changed after it has already been created.
setting.enableDataSubjectPurposeChangesDesc: Enable this feature to send smaller payloads when a data subject element is changed after it has already been created.
setting.dataSubjectPreferencePurposeChangesDesc: Enable this feature to send smaller payloads when a data subject purpose preference is changed after it has already been created.
setting.collectTransactionsOfConsentWithheldOnTh: Collect transactions of Consent Withheld on this Interface
Enable this setting to allow the system to record user consent denials as transactions, which will be stored with the status: Not Given.
setting.showCurrentPurposeSubscriptionStatusDesc: Displays the last saved and stored purpose status for each purpose displayed in the interface.
setting.sendEmailsWhenTheInterfaceChangesTitle: Send emails when the interface changes.
setting.sendEmailsWhenTheInterfaceChangesDesc: Send email notifications when the interface is updated.
setting.sendEmailsWhenTheDataSubjectChangesTitle: Send emails when the data subject changes.
setting.sendEmailsWhenTheDataSubjectChangesDesc: Send email notifications when the data subject is updated.
setting.sendEmailsWhenUnsubscribingFromInterface: Send emails when unsubscribing from interface data.
Send email notifications when unsubscribe from data on this interface.

dataelement.title: Data Element
dataelement.description: A list of data elements for use on the interfaces (like email number, text, selection, etc.).
dataelement.translationdescription: When Data Element displayed publicly, Data Element will use translations for both the default and additional languages.
dataelement.addlanguage: Select to add translations for your Data Element

form.ispersonaldatainfo: Allows you to selectively remove this data element from receipts and transactions when deleting data subject records.
form.dataelementinfodesc: Please provide basic user attributes to be displayed in and used for logging into the application.
form.isindentifier: Can be used as an identifier
form.manageoptiondesc: Add the options that can be selected for the data element.
form.isispersonaldataInfo: Allows you to selectively remove this data element from receipts and transactions when deleting data subject records.

404.title: Page Not Found
404.description: Sorry, we can’t find the page you’re looking for.

401.title: Unauthorized Error
401.description: Access is denied due to invalid Credentials.

standardPurpose.title: Standard Purpose
standardPurpose.description: Standard purposes refer to the specific objectives for which a data subject’s personal data is collected and processed.

updateInterface.title: Update to Consent Interface
updateInterface.description: If you updated and published the standard purpose, the affected consent interface will be created, with new drafts and versions that you can choose to update to the interfaces.

actions.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this purpose?

preferenceModal.title: Add Preference Purpose
preferenceModal.description: Select preferences to capture more granular options related to this purpose.

standardPurposeInfo.title: Standard Purpose Info
standardPurposeInfo.description: Create a purpose for collecting and processing data. Consent will be captured for this purpose.

preferencePurposes.title: Preference Purposes
preferencePurposes.description: Select preference purposes that can be linked to standard purposes to encompass a broader range of data subject preferences.

publishPopup.title: Confirm Publish Purpose
publishPopup.description: You will not be able to make further changes without creating a new version. All interfaces will change.
publishPopup.line2: You will not be able to add a new Preference Purpose.
publishPopup.line3: Editing a Preference Purpose will not affect the associated Standard Purpose.
publishPopup.line4: The interface will generate a new draft and version if published.
publishPopup.line5: Would you like to proceed with this update?

versions.title: All Versions
versions.description: The intent of all preceding versions of this standard.

privacyNotices.description: Create and manage privacy notice to inform data subjects about how their personal data is collected, used, and shared.
privacyNotices.interfaceBuilderDesc: Enter the required details to create a privacy notice that aligns with your organization's policies and compliance requirements.
privacyNotices.interactionsDescription: Setting up and managing connections (Integrations) with other systems or platforms.
privacyNotices.publishSdkDesc: Copy this code and paste it in any page you want to display this privacy notice. As long as you update this exact privacy notice in OneTrust, the code will always show the latest published version, so you don’t need to copy and paste it each time you update. Published changes may take up to 4 hours to appear in the code.
privacyNotices.copyDesc: Copy the script below to embed the preference center within your own websites.
privacyNotices.translateDesc: When This Privacy Notice displayed publicly, Notice will use translations for both the default and additional languages.
privacyNotices.addLanguage: Select to add translations for your Privacy Notice

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: Setting up and managing connections (Integrations) with other systems or platforms.
integrations.userthisURL: Use this URL to provide a link to the Preference Center login screen.
integrations.youMustPublish: You must publish your Preference Center before data subjects can log in. You can also add a language query parameter to direct data subjects to the login screen in a specific language, e.g. ?language=fr. You must have previously set your Preference Center to support the language for this to work.
integrations.replaceToken: Create direct login links for each data subject profiles.
integrations.replaceTokenWith: You must select the desired purpose for using the data before using this link. Once a user clicks on the link,, the data subject's consent for this purpose will be withdrawn.
integrations.copyTheDirect: Copy the direct link to the web form. Submitting data through this form will mark it as production data. You can share, bookmark, or add this link as a hyperlink on your website.
integrations.useThislink: Copy the direct link to the web form. Submitting data through this form will mark it as test data. You can share, bookmark, or add this link as a hyperlink on your website.
integrations.copyTheScript: Copy the script below to embed the preference center within your own websites.
integrations.theConsentRecript: The Consent Receipt API allows an external application to submit a request to a specific Collection Point to generate a receipt.
integrations.useThislinktoTest: Use this link to test your web form. Saved, unpublished changes will be available via this link. Any transactions and data subjects created will be marked as “Test”.
integrations.identifier: identifier is the value to be stored to identify the individual. It should be the same data type as specified in the Collection Point. In this example it is email address.
integrations.requestInformation: RequestInformation is the API token which identifies the specific Collection Point and data to be stored in OneTrust. The JWT is created on the Collection Point and becomes a fixed value after being made active. It needs to be sent unaltered in the payload or it will not validate.
integrations.purposes: Purposes is an array of IDs for each expected Purpose that consent is given for. If the purpose array is empty, no receipt will be generated.
integrations.dsDataElements: dsDataElements contains attributes used to collect additional data about Data Subjects.
integrations.test: A “test”: true parameter is supported to distinguish test from production receipts. This adds a Test flag to data subjects to allow for easier deletion. This only needs to be added when you want to generate test data on an Active or Retired Collection Point.
integrations.enableDataElementDateValidation: A “enableDataElementDateValidation”: true parameter can be used to make data elements retain the value of the receipt with the latest interaction date, regardless of order received.
integrations.transactionTypes: The following transaction types are supported for custom API collection points: PENDING, CONFIRMED, WITHDRAWN, EXPIRED, NOTGIVEN, OPT_OUT, NO_CHOICE, HARD_OPT_OUT, EXTEND, CANCEL, CHANGE_PREFERENCES, NO_OPT_OUT, IMPLICIT.
integrations.parentPrimaryIdentifiers: parentPrimaryIdentifiers must be used to capture identifiers for parent data subjects when enabling the parent-child relationship setting on the collection point.
integrations.consentGivenBy: ConsentGivenBy is only applicable when more than 1 parent identifiers are passed.

transactions.description: Search and show all transactions recorded via this interface.

modalDeleteDataSubject.option2: Delete Data Subject , Reciepts and Transactions

clientCredentials.title: Client Credentials
clientCredentials.description: Generate and manage credentials for application-level API access.

confirmReset.title: Reset Secret
confirmReset.description: Your current secret will no longer work after reset. Please note that resetting your client secret will not invalidate any access tokens, however you will need to update any existing integrations using the old secret because it will no longer work.Do you want to continue?
confirmReset.remark: Are you sure you want to save changes ?

info.title: Infomation
info.subTitle: Generate and manage credentials for application-level API access.
info.name: Name

clientIdAndSecret.title: Client ID & Secret
clientIdAndSecret.description: Use the Client ID and Secret to post a request to the OAuth endpoint and get a bearer token.
clientIdAndSecret.remark1: Please store the Client ID and Secret safely
clientIdAndSecret.remark2: , as you will not be able to access the secret again after leaving this page
clientIdAndSecret.downloadCredentialsSubTitle: Downloads a text file containing the Client ID and Secret to your local system.
clientIdAndSecret.downloadCredentialsDesc: Using the Client ID and Secret below, you can create an application that interacts with APIs protected by OAuth.

reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.desc: Preparation of a report for the review of consent information related to data subject profiles.
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.descCopyReport: Create a new report by copying an existing report and give this report a name and description
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.descCreateReport: Create a new report intended for the review of consent information pertaining to data subject profiles.
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.descViewReport: View the report containing consent information associated with data subject profiles.
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.descEditReport: Edit the report containing consent information associated with data subject profiles.
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.consentOfTheDataSubjectProfiles: Consent of the Data Subject Profiles
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.descConsent: A list of consent information associated with the data subject profiles for which a report is to be generated. You can apply filters to view the desired data.
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.filterDesc: Filters allow you to customize data views.
reportDataSubjectProfileConsent.pleaseSelectStartEndDate: Please Select Start and End Date

mainPage.title: Home
mainPage.consentManagementDesc: Allow users to easily manage their preferences on all channels
mainPage.privacyNoticeDesc: Manage and update policies, notices, and disclosures from a single location.
mainPage.dashboardAndReportsDesc: Centralized dashboards and reports formonitoring and tracking PDPA consent.
mainPage.settingsDesc: Customize the PDPA application to trackand manageuser consent efficiently.
